seg-source.mrk: Syntax

target.mrk: Syntax

trans-unit.source: { UPDATE tableName [ [ AS ] correlationName ] ] SET columnName = value [ , columnName = value ]* [ WHERE clause ] | UPDATE tableName SET columnName = value [ , columnName = value ]* WHERE CURRENT OF }

seg-source.mrk: { UPDATE tableName [ [ AS ] correlationName ] ] SET columnName = value [ , columnName = value ]* [ WHERE clause ] | UPDATE tableName SET columnName = value [ , columnName = value ]* WHERE CURRENT OF }

target.mrk: { UPDATE tableName [ [ AS ] correlationName ] ] SET columnName = value [ , columnName = value ]* [ WHERE clause ] | UPDATE tableName SET columnName = value [ , columnName = value ]* WHERE CURRENT OF }

seg-source.mrk: where <varname>value</varname> is defined as follows:

target.mrk: where <varname>value</varname> is defined as follows:

seg-source.mrk: expression | DEFAULT

target.mrk: expression | DEFAULT

trans-unit.source: The first syntactical form, called a searched update, updates the value of one or more columns for all rows of the table for which the WHERE clause evaluates to TRUE.

seg-source.mrk: The first syntactical form, called a searched update, updates the value of one or more columns for all rows of the table for which the WHERE clause evaluates to TRUE.

target.mrk: The first syntactical form, called a searched update, updates the value of one or more columns for all rows of the table for which the WHERE clause evaluates to TRUE.

trans-unit.source: The second syntactical form, called a positioned update, updates one or more columns on the current row of an open, updatable cursor. If columns were specified in the <xref href="rrefsqlj31783.dita#rrefsqlj31783">FOR UPDATE clause</xref> of the SELECT statement used to generate the cursor, only those columns can be updated. If no columns were specified or the select statement did not include a FOR UPDATE clause, all columns may be updated.

seg-source.mrk: The second syntactical form, called a positioned update, updates one or more columns on the current row of an open, updatable cursor.
If columns were specified in the <xref href="rrefsqlj31783.dita#rrefsqlj31783">FOR UPDATE clause</xref> of the SELECT statement used to generate the cursor, only those columns can be updated.
If no columns were specified or the select statement did not include a FOR UPDATE clause, all columns may be updated.

target.mrk: The second syntactical form, called a positioned update, updates one or more columns on the current row of an open, updatable cursor.
If columns were specified in the <xref href="rrefsqlj31783.dita#rrefsqlj31783">FOR UPDATE clause</xref> of the SELECT statement used to generate the cursor, only those columns can be updated.
If no columns were specified or the select statement did not include a FOR UPDATE clause, all columns may be updated.

trans-unit.source: Specifying DEFAULT for the update value sets the value of the column to the default defined for that table.

seg-source.mrk: Specifying DEFAULT for the update value sets the value of the column to the default defined for that table.

target.mrk: Specifying DEFAULT for the update value sets the value of the column to the default defined for that table.

trans-unit.source: The DEFAULT literal is the only value which you can directly assign to a generated column. Whenever you alter the value of a column referenced by the generationClause of a generated column, recalculates the value of the generated column.

seg-source.mrk: The DEFAULT literal is the only value which you can directly assign to a generated column.
Whenever you alter the value of a column referenced by the generationClause of a generated column, recalculates the value of the generated column.

target.mrk: The DEFAULT literal is the only value which you can directly assign to a generated column.
Whenever you alter the value of a column referenced by the generationClause of a generated column, recalculates the value of the generated column.

seg-source.mrk: Example

target.mrk: Example

trans-unit.source: -- All the employees except the manager of -- department (WORKDEPT) 'E21' have been temporarily reassigned. -- Indicate this by changing their job (JOB) to NULL and their pay -- (SALARY, BONUS, COMM) values to zero in the EMPLOYEE table. UPDATE EMPLOYEE SET JOB=NULL, SALARY=0, BONUS=0, COMM=0 WHERE WORKDEPT = 'E21' AND JOB <> 'MANAGER' -- PROMOTE the job (JOB) of employees without a specific job title to MANAGER UPDATE EMPLOYEE SET JOB = 'MANAGER' WHERE JOB IS NULL; // Increase the project staffing (PRSTAFF) by 1.5 for all projects stmt.executeUpdate("UPDATE PROJECT SET PRSTAFF = " "PRSTAFF + 1.5" + "WHERE CURRENT OF" + ResultSet.getCursorName()); -- Change the job (JOB) of employee number (EMPNO) '000290' in the EMPLOYEE table -- to its DEFAULT value which is NULL UPDATE EMPLOYEE SET JOB = DEFAULT WHERE EMPNO = '000290'

seg-source.mrk: <b><ph>-- All the employees except the manager of -- department (WORKDEPT) 'E21' have been temporarily reassigned.
-- Indicate this by changing their job (JOB) to NULL and their pay -- (SALARY, BONUS, COMM) values to zero in the EMPLOYEE table.</ph>

UPDATE EMPLOYEE SET JOB=NULL, SALARY=0, BONUS=0, COMM=0 WHERE WORKDEPT = 'E21' AND JOB <> 'MANAGER' -- PROMOTE the job (JOB) of employees without a specific job title to MANAGER UPDATE EMPLOYEE SET JOB = 'MANAGER' WHERE JOB IS NULL; // Increase the project staffing (PRSTAFF) by 1.5 for all projects stmt.executeUpdate("UPDATE PROJECT SET PRSTAFF = " "PRSTAFF + 1.5" + "WHERE CURRENT OF" + ResultSet.getCursorName()); -- Change the job (JOB) of employee number (EMPNO) '000290' in the EMPLOYEE table -- to its DEFAULT value which is NULL UPDATE EMPLOYEE SET JOB = DEFAULT WHERE EMPNO = '000290'

target.mrk: <b><ph>-- All the employees except the manager of -- department (WORKDEPT) 'E21' have been temporarily reassigned.
-- Indicate this by changing their job (JOB) to NULL and their pay -- (SALARY, BONUS, COMM) values to zero in the EMPLOYEE table.</ph>

UPDATE EMPLOYEE SET JOB=NULL, SALARY=0, BONUS=0, COMM=0 WHERE WORKDEPT = 'E21' AND JOB <> 'MANAGER' -- PROMOTE the job (JOB) of employees without a specific job title to MANAGER UPDATE EMPLOYEE SET JOB = 'MANAGER' WHERE JOB IS NULL; // Increase the project staffing (PRSTAFF) by 1.5 for all projects stmt.executeUpdate("UPDATE PROJECT SET PRSTAFF = " "PRSTAFF + 1.5" + "WHERE CURRENT OF" + ResultSet.getCursorName()); -- Change the job (JOB) of employee number (EMPNO) '000290' in the EMPLOYEE table -- to its DEFAULT value which is NULL UPDATE EMPLOYEE SET JOB = DEFAULT WHERE EMPNO = '000290'

seg-source.mrk: Statement dependency system

target.mrk: Statement dependency system

trans-unit.source: A searched update statement depends on the table being updated, all of its conglomerates (units of storage such as heaps or indexes), all of its constraints, and any other table named in the WHERE clause or SET expressions. A CREATE or DROP INDEX statement or an ALTER TABLE statement for the target table of a prepared searched update statement invalidates the prepared searched update statement.

seg-source.mrk: A searched update statement depends on the table being updated, all of its conglomerates (units of storage such as heaps or indexes), all of its constraints, and any other table named in the WHERE clause or SET expressions.
A CREATE or DROP INDEX statement or an ALTER TABLE statement for the target table of a prepared searched update statement invalidates the prepared searched update statement.

target.mrk: A searched update statement depends on the table being updated, all of its conglomerates (units of storage such as heaps or indexes), all of its constraints, and any other table named in the WHERE clause or SET expressions.
A CREATE or DROP INDEX statement or an ALTER TABLE statement for the target table of a prepared searched update statement invalidates the prepared searched update statement.

trans-unit.source: The positioned update statement depends on the cursor and any tables the cursor references. You can compile a positioned update even if the cursor has not been opened yet. However, removing the open cursor with the JDBC close method invalidates the positioned update.

seg-source.mrk: The positioned update statement depends on the cursor and any tables the cursor references.
You can compile a positioned update even if the cursor has not been opened yet.
However, removing the open cursor with the JDBC close method invalidates the positioned update.

target.mrk: The positioned update statement depends on the cursor and any tables the cursor references.
You can compile a positioned update even if the cursor has not been opened yet.
However, removing the open cursor with the JDBC close method invalidates the positioned update.

trans-unit.source: A CREATE or DROP INDEX statement or an ALTER TABLE statement for the target table of a prepared positioned update invalidates the prepared positioned update statement.

seg-source.mrk: A CREATE or DROP INDEX statement or an ALTER TABLE statement for the target table of a prepared positioned update invalidates the prepared positioned update statement.

target.mrk: A CREATE or DROP INDEX statement or an ALTER TABLE statement for the target table of a prepared positioned update invalidates the prepared positioned update statement.

trans-unit.source: Dropping an alias invalidates a prepared update statement if the latter statement uses the alias.

seg-source.mrk: Dropping an alias invalidates a prepared update statement if the latter statement uses the alias.

target.mrk: Dropping an alias invalidates a prepared update statement if the latter statement uses the alias.

trans-unit.source: Dropping or adding triggers on the target table of the update invalidates the update statement.

seg-source.mrk: Dropping or adding triggers on the target table of the update invalidates the update statement.

target.mrk: Dropping or adding triggers on the target table of the update invalidates the update statement.
